GitHub Copilot-SWE, a new experimental model in GitHub Copilot, is now rolling out to Visual Studio Code Insiders as part of a technical preview. Optimized for code-related tasks like editing,…

The post [Copilot-SWE model rolling out to Visual Studio Code Insiders](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-09-22-copilot-swe-model-rolling-out-to-visual-studio-code-insiders) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
Author: Allison
Title: Copilot-SWE model rolling out to Visual Studio Code Insiders
EnhancedContent:
GitHub Copilot-SWE, a new experimental model in GitHub Copilot, is now rolling out to [Visual Studio Code Insiders](https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/) as part of a technical preview.

Optimized for code-related tasks like editing, refactoring, and small code transformations, GitHub Copilot-SWE is a task-focused model. It’s designed for working with GitHub Copilot inside VS Code. GitHub Copilot-SWE can be used in any [Chat Mode in VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/custom-chat-modes). We recommend writing detailed prompts or using [prompt files](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/prompt-files) when using GitHub Copilot-SWE.

# Availability in GitHub Copilot

GitHub Copilot-SWE will be available to all Copilot individual users through [VS Code Insiders](https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/). Rollout will be gradual — ensure you have the latest version of VS Code Insiders installed and check back soon if you don’t see it yet.

# Learn more

To explore all models available in GitHub Copilot, see [our documentation on models](https://docs.github.com/copilot/reference/ai-models/supported-models). For more information on selecting models in VS Code, see [VS Code documentation on GitHub Copilot models](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/language-models).

If you would like to provide feedback on Copilot-SWE from within [VS Code Insiders](https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/), please use the `Report Issue` button within the [VS Code chat panel](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/chat/copilot-chat).
